column4: how do i do the equivalent to CHKDSK - i have reason to believe my fs needs fixing
you can still run it in read-only mode. it will detect but not correct errors, if any. otherwise, you should boot into recovery mode, and remount as read-only
or perhaps just boot from a live cd. or, third option, set the filesystem's "dirty" flag, so that it'll be checked at next reboot. except i don't remember how to set that flag
